abstract.text: Creates a list that computes its views on demand over a constant range,
optionally allowing users to select a single row.

abstract.text: Declare the user interface and behavior for your app on every platform.
A property wrapper type that can read and write a value owned by a source of
truth.
A structure that computes views on demand from an underlying collection of
identified data.
A view that arranges its subviews in a horizontal line.
A container that presents rows of data arranged in a single column,
optionally providing the ability to select one or more members.
Creates a list that identifies its rows based on a key path to the
identifier of the underlying data, optionally allowing users to select a
single row.
Creates a list that computes its rows on demand from an underlying
collection of identifiable data, optionally allowing users to select a
single row.
Creates a list that computes its views on demand over a constant range,
optionally allowing users to select multiple rows.
Creates a list that computes its rows on demand from an underlying
collection of identifiable data, optionally allowing users to select a
single row.
Creates a list that computes its rows on demand from an underlying
collection of identifiable data and allowing users to have exactly
one row always selected.
Creates a list that computes its views on demand over a constant range,
optionally allowing users to select a single row.
Creates a list that computes its rows on demand from an underlying
collection of identifiable data, optionally allowing users to select
multiple rows.
Creates a list that computes its views on demand over a constant range
and allowing users to have exactly one row always selected.
Creates a list that computes its rows on demand from an underlying
collection of identifiable data, optionally allowing users to select
multiple rows.
A type that represents part of your apps user interface and provides
modifiers that you use to configure views.
A custom parameter attribute that constructs views from closures.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A collection that supports subscript assignment.
A type representing the sequences elements.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
An unordered collection of unique elements.
A signed integer value type.
A collection that supports efficient random-access index traversal.
A type that represents a position in the collection.
A type that represents the indices that are valid for subscripting the collection, in ascending order.
A half-open interval from a lower bound up to, but not including, an upper bound.
A class of types whose instances hold the value of an entity with stable identity.
A type representing the stable identity of the entity associated with an instance.

A `Sequence` whose elements consist of those in a `Base` `Sequence` passed through a transform function returning `Element`. These elements are computed lazily, each time theyre read, by calling the transform function on a base element.
